001package org.biopax.psidev.ontology_manager.impl;
002
003import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
004import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
005import org.biopax.psidev.ontology_manager.OntologyAccess;
006import org.biopax.psidev.ontology_manager.OntologyTermI;
007
008import java.io.Serializable;
009import java.util.*;
010
011/**
012 * Access to a local ontology in the form of an OBO file.
013 *
014 * @author Florian Reisinger
015 * @author Samuel Kerrien (skerrien@ebi.ac.uk)
016 * @author rodche (baderlab.org) - re-factored/simplified for the BioPAX validator
017 * @since 2.0.0
018 */
019public class OntologyAccessImpl implements OntologyAccess, Serializable {
020
021    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
022
023    public static final Log log = LogFactory.getLog( OntologyAccessImpl.class );
024
025    private String name;
026
027    public OntologyAccessImpl() {
028    }
029
030    public void setName(String name) {
031        this.name = name;
032    }
033
034    public String getName() {
035        return name;
036    }
037
038    public Set<OntologyTermI> getValidTerms( String accession, boolean allowChildren, boolean useTerm ) {
039        Set<OntologyTermI> collectedTerms = new HashSet<>();
040
041        final OntologyTermI term = getTermForAccession( accession );
042        if ( term != null ) {
043            if ( useTerm ) {
044                collectedTerms.add( term );
045            }
046
047            if ( allowChildren ) {
048                collectedTerms.addAll( getAllChildren( term ) );
049            }
050        }
051
052        return collectedTerms;
053    }
054
055
056    /**
057     * Pool of all term contained in that ontology.
058     */
059    private Collection<OntologyTermI> ontologyTerms = new ArrayList<>( 1024 );
060
061    /**
062     * Represent the relationship: child -> parents.
063     */
064    private final Map<OntologyTermI, Set<OntologyTermI>> parents = new HashMap<>();
065
066    /**
067     * Represent the relationship: parent -> children.
068     */
069    private final Map<OntologyTermI, Set<OntologyTermI>> children = new HashMap<>();
070
071    /**
072     * Mapping of all OboTerm by their ID.
073     */
074    private Map<String, OntologyTermI> id2ontologyTerm = new HashMap<>( 1024 );
075
076    /**
077     * Collection of root terms of that ontology. A root term is defined as follow: term having no parent.
078     */
079    private Collection<OntologyTermI> roots = null;
080
081    /**
082     * List of all obsolete term found while loading the ontology.
083     */
084    private Collection<OntologyTermI> obsoleteTerms = new ArrayList<>();
085
086    /**
087     * Add a new Term in the pool. It will be indexed by its ID.
088     *
089     * @param term the OntologyTerm to add in that OntologyAccess.
090     */
091    public void addTerm( OntologyTermI term ) {
092        ontologyTerms.add( term );
093        String id = term.getTermAccession();
094        if ( id2ontologyTerm.containsKey( id ) ) {
095            OntologyTermI old = id2ontologyTerm.get( id );
096            log.error( "WARNING: 2 Objects have the same ID (" + id
097              + "), the old one is being replaced. old: "
098              + old.getPreferredName() + " new: " + term.getPreferredName() );
099        }
100        id2ontologyTerm.put( id, term );
101        flushRootsCache();
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Create a relashionship parent to child between two OntologyTerm.
106     *
107     * @param parentId The parent term.
108     * @param childId  The child term.
109     */
110    public void addLink(String parentId, String childId) {
111        OntologyTermI child = id2ontologyTerm.get(childId);
112        OntologyTermI parent = id2ontologyTerm.get(parentId);
113        if (child == null || parent == null) {
114            throw new NullPointerException("You must give a non null " +
115              "child/parent for addLink method!");
116        } else {
117            if (!children.containsKey(parent)) {
118                children.put(parent, new HashSet<>());
119            }
120            if (!parents.containsKey(child)) {
121                parents.put(child, new HashSet<>());
122            }
123            children.get(parent).add(child);
124            parents.get(child).add(parent);
125            flushRootsCache();
126        }
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Remove the Root cache from memory.<br/> That method should be called
131     * every time the collection of OntologyTerm is altered.
132     */
133    private void flushRootsCache() {
134        if ( roots != null ) {
135            // flush roots cache
136            roots.clear();
137            roots = null;
138        }
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Answer the question: 'Has that ontology any term loaded ?'.
143     *
144     * @return true is there are any terms loaded, false otherwise.
145     */
146    public boolean hasTerms() {
147        return ontologyTerms.isEmpty();
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Search for a OboTerm by its ID.
152     *
153     * @param id the identifier of the OntologyTerm we are looking for.
154     * @return a OntologyTerm or null if not found.
155     */
156    public OntologyTermI search( String id ) {
157        return id2ontologyTerm.get( id );
158    }
159
160    public boolean hasParent( OntologyTermI term ) {
161        return parents.containsKey( term );
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Get the Root terms of the ontology. The way to get it is as follow: pick a term at random, and go to his highest
166     * parent.
167     *
168     * @return a collection of Root term.
169     */
170    public Collection<OntologyTermI> getRoots() {
171        if ( roots != null ) {
172            return roots;
173        }
174
175        // it wasn't precalculated, then do it here...
176        roots = new HashSet<>();
177
178        for ( Iterator iterator = ontologyTerms.iterator(); iterator.hasNext(); ) {
179            OntologyTermI ontologyTerm = ( OntologyTermI ) iterator.next();
180            if ( !hasParent( ontologyTerm ) ) {
181                roots.add( ontologyTerm );
182            }
183        }
184
185        if ( roots.isEmpty() ) {
186            return Collections.emptyList();
187        }
188
189        return roots;
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Get all OboTerm.
194     *
195     * @return all OntologyAccess term found in the OntologyAccess.
196     */
197    public Collection<OntologyTermI> getOntologyTerms() {
198        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection( ontologyTerms );
199    }
200
201    public void addObsoleteTerm( OntologyTermI term ) {
202        if ( term == null ) {
203            throw new IllegalArgumentException( "You must give a non null term" );
204        }
205
206        log.debug( "Adding obsolete term: " + term.getTermAccession() + " " + term.getPreferredName() );
207        obsoleteTerms.add( term );
208    }
209
210    public boolean isObsolete( OntologyTermI term ) {
211        return obsoleteTerms.contains( term );
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Go through the list of all CV Term and select those that are obsolete.
216     *
217     * @return a non null Collection of obsolete term.
218     */
219    public Collection<OntologyTermI> getObsoleteTerms() {
220        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection( obsoleteTerms );
221    }
222
223    public Set<OntologyTermI> getDirectParents( OntologyTermI term ) {
224        final Set<OntologyTermI> directParents = parents.get( term );
225        if ( directParents == null ) {
226            return Collections.emptySet();
227        } else {
228            return directParents;
229        }
230    }
231
232    public Set<OntologyTermI> getDirectChildren( OntologyTermI term ) {
233        final Set<OntologyTermI> directChildren = children.get( term );
234        if ( directChildren == null ) {
235            return Collections.emptySet();
236        } else {
237            return directChildren;
238        }
239    }
240
241    public Set<OntologyTermI> getAllParents( OntologyTermI term ) {
242        Set<OntologyTermI> parents = new HashSet<>();
243        getAllParents( term, parents );
244        return parents;
245    }
246
247    private void getAllParents( OntologyTermI term, Set<OntologyTermI> parents ) {
248        final Collection<OntologyTermI> directParents = getDirectParents( term );
249        parents.addAll( directParents );
250        for ( OntologyTermI parent : directParents ) {
251            getAllParents( parent, parents );
252        }
253    }
254
255    public Set<OntologyTermI> getAllChildren( OntologyTermI term ) {
256        Set<OntologyTermI> children = new HashSet<>();
257        getAllChildren( term, children );
258        return children;
259    }
260
261    private void getAllChildren( OntologyTermI term, Set<OntologyTermI> children ) {
262        getAllChildren( "", term, children, new HashSet(512) );
263    }
264
265    private void getAllChildren( String prefix, OntologyTermI term, Set<OntologyTermI> children,
266                                 Set<String> traversedChildren )
267    {
268        if( traversedChildren.contains( term.getTermAccession() ) ) {
269            return;
270        }
271        final Collection<OntologyTermI> directChildren = getDirectChildren( term );
272        traversedChildren.add( term.getTermAccession() );
273        children.addAll( directChildren );
274        for ( OntologyTermI child : directChildren ) {
275            getAllChildren( prefix+"     ", child, children, traversedChildren );
276        }
277    }
278
279    // Utility - Display methods
280
281    public void print() {
282        log.info( ontologyTerms.size() + " terms to display." );
283        final Collection<OntologyTermI> roots = getRoots();
284        log.info( this.roots.size() + " root(s) found." );
285        for ( OntologyTermI root : roots ) {
286            print( root );
287        }
288    }
289
290    private void print( OntologyTermI term, String indent ) {
291        log.info( indent + term.getTermAccession() + "   " + term.getPreferredName() );
292        for ( OntologyTermI child : getDirectChildren( term ) ) {
293            print( child, indent + "  " );
294        }
295    }
296
297    public void print( OntologyTermI term ) {
298        print( term, "" );
299    }
300
301    public OntologyTermI getTermForAccession(String accession) {
302        return search(accession);
303    }
304}
